<h1 class="post-title">
<span class="the-title">The Last of our Human Freedoms – Covid-1984 meets the Brave New Normal</span> </h1>
<div class="post-author">
<a href="https://off-guardian.org/author/admin/" title="All posts by Editor">Editor</a> </div>
</div>
<div class="post_page-content post">
<h6>Greg Maybury</h6>
<a href="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/george-guidestones-greg-maybury-banner.jpg?x46269"><img alt="" class="aligncenter size-offg-header-image-2 wp-image-78334" decoding="async" height="900" sizes="(max-width: 2000px) 100vw, 2000px" src="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/george-guidestones-greg-maybury-banner-2000x900.jpg?x46269" srcset="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/george-guidestones-greg-maybury-banner-2000x900.jpg 2000w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/george-guidestones-greg-maybury-banner-500x226.jpg 500w, https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/george-guidestones-greg-maybury-banner-650x294.jpg 650w" width="2000"/></a>
<blockquote class="topquote"><p>“A great majority of the population looks on with complete indifference as the medical papacy assumes ever greater proportion, worming its way into the most diverse fields — for instance, intervening extensively in children’s education, in school life, and staking a claim here to a certain form of therapy.”<br/>
<cite><a href="https://aim4truth.org/2021/09/12/rudolf-steiner-on-the-question-of-vaccinations/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank" title="https://aim4truth.org/2021/09/12/rudolf-steiner-on-the-question-of-vaccinations/">Rudolf Steiner</a>, 1924</cite></p></blockquote>
<blockquote class="topquote"><p>“The last of the human freedoms [is] to choose one’s attitude.”<br/>
<cite><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22278043-man-s-search-for-ultimate-meaning" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank" title="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22278043-man-s-search-for-ultimate-meaning">Victor Frankl</a>, 1974.</cite>
</p></blockquote>
<p class="dropcap">In an age of angst, animus and anomie, ‘controversy’ still rages on all things Covid. Yet many scientists, researchers, health-care providers and medical professionals—even former pharmaceutical executives and senior staffers—bravely stand fast against the toxic tide of this new tyranny. </p>
<p>This alone is clear evidence something is decidedly wrong with the official narrative. My <a href="https://poxamerikana.com/2021/01/29/the-psychic-dangers-of-infected-minds-with-a-lie-this-large/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">feature length essay</a> on the subject earlier this year — “The Psychic Dangers of Infected Minds (With a Lie this Large)” — posited in fact the notion the real “virus” was of a different, less tangible, yet far more insidious, perhaps even <i>incurable</i>, kind. </p>
<p>Since publishing it, the “minds” have become ever more infected, our responses more ‘Pavlovian’; the lies larger, more frequent, contradictory, absurd. And more widely spread. With the truth becoming more distorted, fragmented, censored. And soon to be perhaps punishable by law, a statement which is not by any stretch hyperbole. Oh that were the case. </p>
<p>That said, some of the natives are getting restless<i>. </i>Here’s an update cum sit-rep on the unsettling “settled” science of the ‘BigPharmafia-Medical’ papacy. Suit up, lock n’ load, secure the perimeters now. Prepare to engage the enemy!</p>
<h4>The Pandoras of the Pandemic (Our Malevolent Malthusians)</h4>
<p>In January 2020, I was invited to a small conference outside Edinburgh of independent political writers, activists, historians, and scribes of the dissident kind. There I was uniquely privileged to meet and greet with a broad range of kindreds. </p>
<p>Committed truth pilgrims and myriad political ‘refuseniks’ one and all, if there was a single thing we all had in common it might be found amongst any of the following: A nose for official duplicity, cant and perfidy; an unerring disdain for propaganda and hype; a palpable sense of creeping democratic devolution; and an abiding resistance to the manipulative, insidious agendas being imposed upon us by the upper echelons of the global ruling class elites.</p>
<p>Such “agendas” are of course all too eagerly facilitated by the elites’ ‘useful idiots’ and their craven commissars, who for the moment at least are a privileged, even protected species. Unlike <a href="https://www.lewrockwell.com/2021/09/doug-casey/the-next-crisis-the-global-elite-have-planned/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">the rest of us</a>, as we’ll see!</p>
<p>The events of the past eighteen months have revealed for those of us looking at least <i>who</i> these people are, and <i>what</i> that overarching agenda is all about. For our purposes herein one such conference participant stands out. </p>
<p>Helen Buyniski; a young, native New Yorker is as righteous as one might reasonably expect. Blogging under the wickedly seditious handle of “<a href="http://helenofdestroy.com/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Helen of Destroy”</a>, Ms Buyniski has an opinion or three about what is manifestly wrong with the Anglo-American-Zionist world in general, and is not shy about ‘spreading the love’.</p>
<p>In short, this is a political activist <i>par excellence</i> — who <a href="https://alethonews.com/2020/05/18/duck-and-cover-and-burn-the-heretics-the-modern-day-cult-of-corona/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">thankfully eschews</a> the nominally disparate, yet decidedly tedious, dogmas and slogans that characterise the <a href="https://fort-russ.com/2021/01/how-an-austrian-and-british-malthusian-brainwashed-a-generation-of-americans/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">left v right political discourse</a> — and one who sees little point in ‘taking prisoners’. </p>
<p>If you are, though, someone who can handle unvarnished revelations about the machinations of the elites and wish to get a handle on the chaos and calamity the Great Resetters seek to impose upon all of us, then Buyniski is your go-to (wo)man! We should be forever grateful she’s on our side and not theirs, and more than a little disappointed we can’t actually clone her!</p>
<p>After her <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u3Icd0YqZi0" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">28 minute presentation</a>, she left the stage with us all wanting for more. Which is not the same as saying what she had to say warmed the cockles of our respective hearts. Not by a long shot from the Grassy Knoll! </p>
<p>Having just revisited her presentation, it is now after eighteen months of Covid that the full import of her ‘diatribe’ is coming home to roost, and that all things being equal (rare to be sure), the much-touted benefits of hindsight can scarcely be overstated.</p>
<p>Now space inhibits a ‘blow by blow’ of the import of what she had to say, as she covered a lot of real estate. Below though is something of a ‘thumbnail’ — essentially an expose of the intricate synergies of the globally systemic propaganda, censorship, power, and control dynamics as they then stood — all themes which I explored <a href="http://poxamerikana.com/2019/07/31/inside-the-submissive-void-propaganda-censorship-power-control-2/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">in this treatise </a>from 2019. And all of which I’ve touched on in most of my <i>other</i> outings, for the simple reason that such matters are key to understanding just about everything going on around us, <i>and</i> pretty much all that’s led us to this point.</p>
<p>We’ll return to Buyniski’s talk soon, but first, this. Whether we know it or not <i>or</i> like it or not, no matter how clever we think we are, or how mindful we might be of — and from that consciously resistant to — the pernicious effects of propaganda and censorship, we’re all susceptible to the enervating forces they unleash, with complacency, ignorance, and hubris being all but a few of them.</p>
<p>Like the rest of the Edinburgh conclave, Buyniski understands this reality indubitably. The regime under which we’ll all be expected to live out our lives according to the dictates of the fatuously tagged “new normal” is <i>not</i> about public health, or our well-being and welfare: that is most assuredly not the case.</p>
<p>What <i>is</i> it all about then?</p>
<p>It is about ‘old fashioned’ <i>power and control</i>, pure, simple, <i>absolute. </i></p>
<p>This time on a scale that, whilst it may have been hitherto imagined — perhaps by James Bond movie villains — has not been attempted. The one singular difference is that <i>007</i> only ever had one ‘bad-guy’ to contend with. We have a long ‘conga-line’ of them, all dancing in lockstep. And they’re both real and dangerous! And preternaturally evil.</p>
<p>For those who truly believe the official narrative of Covid, what follows is <i>not</i> for you. To wit: If you <i>do</i> choose to buy that spiel though, a check-up from the neck-up is highly recommended. Rehab is beckoning!</p>
<h4>Coming to Love our Servitude (The End Time Paradigm)</h4>
<p>Ms Buyniski began her conference session by name-checking the estimable <a href="https://www.academia.edu/11898678/Edward_Bernays_The_Father_of_Public_Relations_and_Architect_of_the_Consumer_Mind" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Edward (“More Doctors Smoke Camels”) Bernays</a>, nephew of none other than Sigmund Freud, and author of the seminal book <a href="https://archive.org/details/BernaysPropaganda" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><i>Propaganda.</i></a></p>
<p>From that point she had our ‘complete and undivided’. Bernays is arguably one of the most influential people of the past century or more that most people have never heard of, which given the nature of the man’s work is perhaps a fitting legacy. It’s instructive to note that Adolf Hitler’s go-to <i>shill-meister</i> Joseph Goebbels was a big fan!</p>
<p>Yet there can be no doubting the man’s vicarious impact on our recent history, our political economy, our society, our education, our culture, our communities, our lives; it’s there but for all the most ill-informed, myopic or self-absorbed to see. His influence is as enduring and incalculable as it is iniquitous and ubiquitous. The aforesaid<i>Propaganda</i> became the ‘go-to’ play-book for the nascent advertising, public relations and perception management industry, whilst he assumed the role of its reigning go-to guru, a roost he ruled for decades.</p>
<p>Here’s what HB had to say by way of introduction [My emphasis].</p>
<div class="transcript">
<p>It’s been a century since Edward Bernays wrote his book <em>Propagand</em>a, unveiling a PR industry that had previously operated only behind the scenes and triggering its growth into an industrial behemoth that now reaches the far corners of the earth. Wars are fought on the level of “hearts and minds” as much as bombs and guns, <b>and huge swathes of the population won’t make a move unless they believe it’s approved by public opinion</b>. </p>
<p>In the past few decades, technology has allowed PR to consolidate its hold on the human mind in a way that was not previously possible…<b>The end goal is to divorce us from everything that makes us human, creating hollowed-out automata eager to receive their marching orders.</b></p>
<p>Far from the days in which advertising was a resented intrusion, we now line up overnight to receive our personal propaganda-delivery devices, and for too many of us, <b>received propaganda has supplanted the development of an individual self.</b>’
</p></div>
<p>As she approached the denouement of her talk, Buyniski asked: <i>‘Where is this headed, and can it be stopped?’ </i>She does not leave the questions, or us, hanging! Readers are strongly encouraged — even before proceeding — to imbibe her message. But the gist of it is this: at around the 20m mark of her riveting, now eerily prescient disquisition, Ms Buyniski subtly ‘laid a Claymore’ that exploded about four weeks after we’d all returned to base-camp. We’re talking here of course the pandemic <i>du jour</i>, Covid-19.</p>
<p>In short, Buyniski proposed only a few examples of the many possible global catastrophes — real, imagined, natural, concocted — whereby those in power might facilitate the “end goal” as set out above. We can all think of numerous such cataclysmic events and the prospect of their appearance: Everything from a financial meltdown, a major solar flare, super-volcano eruption, a dinosaur-destroying meteor strike, a cyber-terrorist attack, an economic collapse, and you guessed, last but not least, <i>a world-wide pandemic</i>! </p>
<p>Whilst Buyniski did not use the word “Covid” or suggest that said “pandemic” was around the corner, she was mos’ def’ on to something!</p>
<p>As I have noted before, in the wake of events which unfolded shortly thereafter and continue to do so as of this writing, it becomes increasingly apparent that the phrase <i>‘never let a good crisis go to waste’</i> has rarely been more cogent. Certainly not since 9/11! </p>
<p>With crass opportunism, unbridled cupidity, and bloody cynicism hardly being concepts foreign to the political animal mind, this phrase not by chance shoehorned itself into the political lexicon in the wake of <i>that</i> memorable event. Though in both instances perhaps, we might add that the subtext of the meme was then and remains now: ‘<i>if we get tired of waiting for a crisis to show up out of the blue ether, go the extra mile and have one tailor-made, fit-for-purpose as it were…’</i></p>
<h4>The Great Swine Flu Swindle of 2009 (and Assorted Campaigns of Panic)</h4>
<p>In order to convey something of the monstrous fraud that’s been perpetrated upon us these past eighteen months, the following trip down the Memory Hole is as good a place to start as any. </p>
<p>In a report from Britain’s <a href="https://odysee.com/@Turricano:5/WHO-scam.-British-television-presenter-John-Snow,-Over-10-years-ago:3?src=bigtech_unauth" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Channel Four from 2010</a>, Wolfgang Wodarg, the then Council of Europe health chief, accused Big Pharma of <i>“unduly influencing World Health Organisation (WHO) decisions”</i> and blueprinting a global <i>“campaign of panic”</i> in response to the so-called Swine Flu (H1N1) outbreak that made its inauspicious debut around twelve months before.</p>
<p>By the time the penny dropped that this much touted existential threat to humanity was far less than the sum of its overblown parts, major European countries (Britain, France, Germany etc.), were “burdened” with tens of millions of doses of useless vaccines for which they’d forked out “hundreds of millions of dollars” of the taxpayers hard-earned. A similar fiasco and furore played out in the US.</p>
<p>Now for those people still ensnared in the net of the official Covid narrative, the preceding alone should provide ample doubt as to its veracity and integrity. </p>
<p>Whether induced by enforced isolation, social distancing, and lockdown fatigue; travel, work, and social restrictions; media fuelled polarisation between “anti-vaxxers” and “pro-vaxxers”; workplace coercion and bullying; truncated and disrupted education for our kids; Stasi-state edicts from on high from leaders getting in touch with their respective inner tyrant; loss of income and business revenue; or fear of mandatory <i>injection</i> with substances that are at best experimental — or any other legitimate concerns which have arisen as this bespoke crisis has unfolded and whose twists and turns are increasingly improvised ‘on the fly’ by self-serving politicians and health bureaucrats — for those predisposed to seeking a more enlightened insight into the agenda of the Great Resetters, I trust the rest provides something of an additional reality check on our collective predicament and the looming perils unleashed upon us by these ‘Pandoras’ of the pandemic.</p>
<p>All the “grim predictions” about the Swine Flu from the hand-wringing hordes in Big Pharma—the Cartel from Hell—in addition to their accomplices in the medical and scientific establishment itself and the ever-reliable wolf-criers in the corporate media—proved to be a giant ‘fizzer’. Though it may not have been viewed that way at the time, in terms of furthering the longer-term agenda and prepping the ground for what was to come, it might now be seen as a roaring success. That’s that “hindsight” thing working overtime again.</p>
<p>It’s notable moreover that the source of <a href="https://www.trueactivist.com/robert-f-kennedy-jr-says-70-of-news-advertising-revenue-comes-from-big-pharma-t1/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">upwards of 70%</a> of the corporate media’s advertising revenue comes from the pharmaceutical industry, though there is perhaps nothing much to see here folks.</p>
<p>And there can be little doubt that far too many of our medical professionals and health care providers have made themselves far more secure and comfortable in their sinecures than they might otherwise have been had they <i>not</i> put their names on Big Pharma’s dance-card. (My own doctor abruptly ‘went into lockdown’ when I tried to discuss my concerns re: all matters Covid. And an old friend—a now retired medical specialist of no small repute—refuses to have anything to do with me now after I questioned the gospel!)</p>
<p>With this in mind, some might be forgiven for suspecting that the ‘pig-pox’ was a dress rehearsal of sorts, as already suggested, to soften us up for a more ambitious gambit. </p>
<p>To fully comprehend this as a real possibility (as distinct from conspiracy theories concocted by cognitively impaired, lizard-brain, loony-toons with too much time on their hands), the following should serve as another all-important reality check. (See <a href="https://off-guardian.org/2021/09/22/30-facts-you-need-to-know-your-covid-cribsheet/?fbclid=IwAR2rA7Zj4JBrcyGWPhWyRZcUuKJCaMrqNnJ3noGzKMyJnsTVFg-6-NOqGXY" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">this link </a>for some Covid myth-busting analysis.)</p>
<h4>This was Not in the Brochure!</h4>
<p>In a recent interview on RT, the high profile US trial attorney <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eWBggxr4TBc" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Mike Papantonio</a><b>,</b> host of the channel’s <i>America’s Lawyer </i>program, let rip on Johnson &amp; Johnson (J&amp;J). J&amp;J are of course the health-care and pharmaceutical behemoth (indeed the biggest), at least one of whose self-styled (albeit ironically so) “<i>family</i> of products” are likely to be found in every home on the planet at any given time. They are also one of many such companies in the industry looking to cash in on Covid.</p>
<p>Before continuing, it is perhaps worth having a gander at the claims J&amp;J make in their ‘brochure’ (i.e. <a href="https://www.jnj.com/about-jnj" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">their website)</a> [my emphasis].</p>
<blockquote><p>At Johnson &amp; Johnson, we are driven to <b>improve the personal health of people everywhere</b>. We deliver products that are rooted in science and endorsed by professionals. Our differentiated portfolio of iconic brands…<b>delivers life-enhancing, first-to-market innovation</b>. By combining the power of science with meaningful human insights and digital-first thinking, <b>we help more than 1.2 billion people live healthier lives every day, from their very first day.’</b>.</p></blockquote>
<p>Now not much therein other than the fact that the self-ascribed, feel-good corporate beneficence is ever so frequently at odds with our consumer reality, something which we all too often forget, or choose to ignore. Which many folks seem to be doing now by embracing the Covid vaccine gospel. </p>
<p>And though J&amp;J may have cornered the market in many of product categories within the industry, their notional ‘competitors’ are equally adept at inundating us with the same obsequious, mealy-mouthed, touchy-feely, ‘we have you best interests at heart’ corporate hype. </p>
<p>What you won’t find featured on their website is anything to do with the following. Again, like their competitors, J&amp;J are no slouches when it comes to ‘damage control’, of which there have been countless case studies in this industry. That being the real “damage” inflicted on consumers by their products, the extent, criminality and tragedy of which is all too frequently only realised by the critical masses after the said “damage” is done and then publicly revealed. After which, their senior ‘suits’ all begin a mad scramble for the exits, their lawyers all screaming at the top of their lungs, “nothing to see here folks!”</p>
<p>That is, any such “damage control” measures are all about ‘ring-fencing the risk’ in order to protect the corporations’ brand image and to minimise any negative impact on its revenues and profit margins. Rarely are the concerns or welfare of those most affected by their poisonous fare factored into the risk minimisation calculus. It’s all about shilling the next pill, shifting the units, and raking in the filthy lucre! And suppressing any and all adverse publicity.</p>
<p>Of course many people might say this is stating the bleeding obvious! Perhaps! But can anyone explain why so many ordinary folks seem to have forgotten this in the age of Covid? </p>
<p>Even for those disinclined toward such conspiratorial musing, one would have to at least wonder if indeed the Swine Flu was not one hell of a shell-game, a swindle in short. It’s a pity that so many seem to have ‘deep-sixed’ the sorry episodes of previous virus scares into the communal Memory Hole. An <i>anamnesis</i> of this sort might have stood us all in good stead in comprehending our current dire travails.</p>
<p>Which is to say, doesn’t any of this ring any bells? It should do! Are we not experiencing a palpable sense of <i>deja vu</i>here? We should be! Alas, the “once bitten, twice shy” refrain doesn’t seem to cut it anymore for an increasing number of people! We have all but adopted a <u><a href="https://idioms.thefreedictionary.com/penny+wise+pound+foolish" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank" title="https://idioms.thefreedictionary.com/penny+wise+pound+foolish">penny-wise, pound-foolish</a></u> mindset when it comes to facing the existential challenges confronting us.</p>
<p>[Author Note: To underscore this conundrum, the following is worth noting: I posted recently a simple straw-poll on Twitter, which sought to ascertain from people the measure of trust they placed in BigPharma. The result from over 16,500 respondents? <i>Ninety-two percent</i> indicated they placed “no trust” in these companies at all, with many comments scathing in tenor! If only we could get 92% of our fellow citizens marching in the streets against this medical tyranny…If only! We probably wouldn’t be having <i>this</i> ‘chinwag’ now!]</p>
<p>Part of this indoctrination process involves keeping everything from us we need to know for as long as possible, and overwhelming us with information that we don’t need. That’s called ‘shaping the narrative’ of course, a time honoured practice in public relations, moulding public opinion, and from there, the confection of consent. To paraphrase <a href="https://marshallmcluhan.com/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Marshall McLuhan</a>, it’s ‘massaging the message’ via every possible medium at their disposal. BigPharma are masters at this!</p>
<p>Moreover, to the best of this writer’s knowledge, no pharmaceutical company has ever voluntarily or unconditionally ‘fessed up to the damaging impacts of any of their products when confronted with incontrovertible evidence to that effect, and done everything to make amends and repair such damage—that is, adequately compensate those affected or so damaged—in a timely, ethical, responsible <i>and</i> satisfactory manner. </p>
<p>But another way, few companies that I’m aware of did not have some knowledge of the damaging effects of their products and did not move heaven and earth to keep such information under-wraps for as long as it was legally and practically feasible to do so.</p>
<h4>Ring-fencing Risk, Maximising Reward (Our Way of Doing Business)</h4>
<p>In June this year, the aforesaid J&amp;J was saddled with a $5billion fine for its part in the opioid pandemic, and in keeping the research findings regarding the effects on people of these ‘killer drugs’ under wraps. In this same segment, the feisty Papantonio raised the not insignificant matter of J&amp;J’s conduct over the carcinogenic effects of its ubiquitous J&amp;J Baby Powder<sup>®</sup>. Like its product ‘stablemate’ BandAid<sup>®</sup>, this product is one of the world’s most famous, enduring brands, the quintessential household name. </p>
<p>Such products have one defining feature: They are a licence to print money! Unlike BandAid<sup>®</sup> (which for the sake of this discussion we’ll assume contains nothing toxic which has heretofore not been publicly revealed), it is far from benign. As with the opioid products it was hawking, J&amp;J had known—<i>for several decades </i>in the case of its baby powder — that its iconic ‘cash-cow’ was a dangerous product (it contained of all things <a href="https://www.cancer.org.au/cancer-information/causes-and-prevention/workplace-cancer/asbestos" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">asbestos</a>, a highly toxic substance if ever there was one), and throughout they kept such information out of the public record.</p>
<p>One wonders for example how those women (and their families) who contracted ovarian cancer as a result of using this product for decades might react to J&amp;J’s insipid, ingratiating corporate gobbledygook as presented above. </p>
<p>This, to say little of the company knowingly and negligently exposing their customers to such debilitating, life-threatening products. Papantonio described these folks as criminal sociopaths. No hyperbole here to be sure! They be <a href="https://www.psychiatry.org/psychiatrists/practice/dsm" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">DSM-5 certified</a>.</p>
<p>With over 33,000 lawsuits pending against J&amp;J in the U.S. alone—and with many more expected—Papantonio reported that the company is looking at a new strategy to dump its Baby Powder®-related liabilities in a new business (effectively a shell company) that would then be ‘entitled’ to file for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. </p>
<p>This arcane but very real corporate/legal avoidance manoeuvre—is called a “divisive merger”. The “Texas Two-step” as Papantonio acerbically describes the “divisive merger” (it originated in the Lone Star State), is the equivalent of the “Get out of Jail Free Card”. </p>
<p>That is, it would be if indeed the prospect of doing time in the Big House for any of these real-life-Monopoly<sup>®</sup>playing misanthropes was the rule rather than the exception. Indeed, Papantonio’s palpable sense of injustice and outrage went as far as the following: <i>“There’ll never be any change [to the status quo] until we throw a few of these people in jail”.</i></p>
<p>When we think of the <a href="http://poxamerikana.com/2015/08/15/the-gangbanksters-of-grab-it-all-street/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">denizens of Wall Street</a> after the GFC (many <i>still</i> laughing all the way home <i>from</i> the bank today), it’s hard to argue with that logic! </p>
<p>But the DM’s purpose is to provide a financial (as distinct from a criminal) liability ‘escape pod’ for J&amp;J to substantially minimise its exposure to these lawsuits or preferably avoid paying any compensation at all. From the off, this latest revelation of corporate malfeasance and white collar criminal negligence raised any number of questions and concerns.</p>
<p>It also presents for us all any number of implications for our own individual and collective roles <i>as consumers</i>. Not least of these are the choices we make, less so of our own volition without some due diligence than those based on the quality, reliability, and credibility of information we are presented by these companies. And which they are compelled—theoretically—by both civil and criminal law requirements and basic ethical standards—good corporate governance anyone?—to provide. Once again, the Covid phenomenon presents us all if we’re willing to see it, enormous implications going forward.</p>
<p>There are a number of factors common to these instances of companies eventually found guilty of malfeasance, negligence, and/or criminal behaviour. To stress: These commonalities are rendered all the more noteworthy with the emergence of the Covid crisis and the attendant controversy surrounding the use of experimental (pseudo) vaccines being evangelised as the panacea by Big Pharma, and all of us who’ve chosen to embrace the “shill” regarding their effectiveness, safety, even necessity.</p>
<ol>
<li>It can takes years—even decades—for issues re: product dangers to come to light, with offenders often found to have hidden, distorted or otherwise prevented damaging findings being released;</li>
<li>It can and often takes years—again decades—of lobbying and litigation for those seeking compensation to obtain it, with people’s very lives and those of their families frequently in the balance throughout;</li>
<li>Companies will pull out every trick in the legal—and not so legal—playbook to avoid or defer accepting moral, ethical, financial, and/or legal responsibility for their actions and decisions;</li>
<li>Rarely are mainstream media organisations for many reason proactive in taking the fight up to the big corporates, not least of which is refusing to risk the advertising revenue stream upon which they depend;</li>
<li>Rarely do politicians of any note regardless of their party affiliations enter the fray on behalf of victims as their own parties are so dependent upon corporate funding with themselves unwilling to place at risk future job prospects once outside public office;</li>
<li>Rarely do any of the relevant regulatory bodies do likewise as many have been neutered, corrupted or at least compromised by ‘regulatory capture’ and the revolving door syndrome;</li>
<li>Rarely do the details of any final—invariably belated as noted—negotiated settlements become public as the agreements frequently bind successful litigants to non-disclosure;</li>
<li>Rarely do any of the companies or their senior executives ever admit any serious liability for the decisions taken, apologise for, or demonstrate any genuine remorse for their past actions and decisions;</li>
<li>Rarely is anyone—past or present—responsible for such decisions in the companies’ concerned personally held accountable or for that matter prosecuted for their actions and the consequences thereof;</li>
<li>And almost no-one, in the U.S. or elsewhere—including here Down Under—ever does serious time in the Big House for their criminal recklessness, duplicity, or fraudulent behaviour and conduct.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Some Conclusions to Go</h4>
<p>It is perhaps notable that the Swine Flu “pandemic” that <i>wasn’t </i>arrived in the wake of the <a href="https://poxamerikana.com/2015/08/15/the-gangbanksters-of-grab-it-all-street/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Global Financial Crisis (GFC)</a> and prevailed more or less throughout the peaks and troughs of its aftermath. </p>
<p>Was this just <i>another</i>coincidence? Or was the Swine Flu scare a distraction from the main game? Or was this the predecessors of the Covid Commissars running this up the flagpole whilst the rest of were more concerned with the stability of the global economy and getting on with our daily lives? </p>
<p>To answer these questions, it’s important to recall what occurred during this period: it was nothing less than the greatest transfer of wealth and property in history from the lower and middle classes to the already super rich and to the large multinational banks, financial institutions, and corporations. Who in themselves are more or less fully owned or controlled subsidiaries of <a href="https://childrenshealthdefense.org/defender/blackrock-vanguard-own-big-pharma-media/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">three to four mega corporate entities</a> with only slightly less than the total value of the US economy (<i>20</i> trillion dollars) in assets under their management.</p>
<p>This includes Big Media, Big Tech, BigFood, BigAg, and numerous other “Bigs” of the global economy. (To see what just <i>one</i> ‘trill’ actually looks like, <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tym9AhMNcP0" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">click here</a>. It’s an eye-popper!)</p>
<p>It then should not come as any great surprise that the recent crisis has again similarly facilitated <i>by stealth </i>an even <a href="https://wallstreetonparade.com/9426-2/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">greater transfer of wealth</a> to these same groups, making the ‘09 heist pale in comparison. </p>
<p>As I’m fond of saying, ‘we don’t need the test results back from the lab to know there are rats in the gravy!’ Bill Gates himself, who has a long history of creating and selling viruses and then offering fixes for them that worked sporadically but still made lots of money off the back of these promises, now <a href="https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/why-is-bill-gates-buying-so-much-land/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">reportedly owns</a> anything up to 65% of America’s prime farmland.</p>
<p>As one of the principal actors in our unfolding drama, one could write a ‘door-stopper’ on the estimable Gates and his role therein along without making much mention of his input into writing its script. (Much less <a href="https://www.jacobinmag.com/2021/08/bill-gates-jeffrey-epstein-mistake-cnn-interview" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">his involvement</a> with the execrable, late Jeffrey Epstein). Yet that would appear to be only one of the more visible, questionable signs that <i>something </i>far bigger—indeed far more insidious than most of us might like to think—is afoot with the Covid agenda; more precisely, <i>‘[something]..is rotten in the state of Denmark’.</i></p>
<p>In any event, all of the above is rendered somewhat academic now that Big Pharma has finagled legal <a href="https://journal-neo.org/2020/04/30/criminal-big-pharma-put-in-charge-of-covid-19-vaccine/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">indemnity from prosecution</a> (essentially ‘suit-proofing’ them) for any and all ill-effects resulting from the use of these Covid vaccines. </p>
<p>But the key point here is that we <i>continue to trust</i> their earnest proclamations that the cure will not be worse than the disease. That they have been properly tested. That they are safe and will cause no harm or minimal side-effects. If Big Pharma’s dodgy track record is any indication, the basis for such trust is shaky indeed.</p>
<p>To underscore this, consider the following. The prohibition on prescribing <a href="https://thecovidblog.com/hydroxychloroquine/" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">hydroxy-chloroquine</a> or <a href="https://rumble.com/vlzihf-the-story-of-ivermectin-and-covid-19.html?fbclid=IwAR0NaHrtjc-BlO49d579wgB-aLShj1osocjOAkhzOMkQYAw7DR47-hlOLgA" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Ivermectin </a>for COVID-19 as suitable alternatives to Big Pharma’s experimental solutions should be of grave concern. Well over 120 peer reviewed scientific studies have shown either drug to be effective in treating and preventing the disease. </p>
<p>Yet here in Australia — where as I write nearly half of the population (of 26m) are under strict lockdown conditions with the Army at one point patrolling the streets of our biggest cities (Sydney &amp; <a href="https://www.9news.com.au/national/violent-construction-protest-melbourne-infiltrated-with-neonazis-fake-tradies-union-boss-john-setka-says/50d20ed8-a7c6-4f17-ae87-6afe2331f7dd" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Melbourne</a>), massive, unprecedented citizen unrest nationally, and no end in sight—the federal government has done a deal with AstraZeneca and we are told we <i>‘cannot expect to go back to normal until a vaccine arrives’.</i></p>
<p>All the while new variants are mysteriously appearing, which doubtless will require ever more testing, lockdowns, follow-up vaccinations, and which will engender more social disunity, economic chaos, psychological disfunction, financial detriment (though not for the political, bureaucratic, financial, and business classes) along with increasing uncertainty—and collective anxiety—amongst ordinary people, about their futures and those of their families.</p>
<p>What we don’t hear in the corporate media is this: Like J&amp;J, AstraZeneca also has a long rap-sheet of corporate malfeasance, corruption and criminality. They have been found guilty of offences relating to off-label or unapproved promotion of medical products; making false claims; kickbacks and bribery; consumer protection violation; sundry healthcare offences; government-contracting violations, and more. </p>
<p>Since 2000 they have <a href="https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/prog.php?parent=astrazeneca" rel="noreferrer nofollow noopener" target="_blank">reportedly been fined</a> over US$1.1 billion dollars for these offences and violations. All treated as a cost of doing business, all factored into operational expenses yet retrieved by excessive profiteering. </p>
<p>And to take our discussion full circle, we cannot leave the corporate media itself out of the big picture here. Their own malfeasance is well documented by myself, Helen Buyniski, and countless others, not simply in capriciously propagating and perpetuating their own brand of truth or creating their own bespoke, self-serving reality on all manner of issues and concerns. </p>
<p>This is especially so wherein accurate, unbiased, and timely information that’s in the public interest is crucial for a well-ordered, stable, functioning, prosperous political economy and the democracy and freedom that’s purportedly an integral part of the milieu of a modern, healthy nation.</p>
<p>You know what I’m talking about here folks: One that’s a better world to live in for our kids <i>and</i> theirs than the one we’ve enjoyed! Let me ask the question one more time. <i>Why do we keep trusting these people?</i> All ‘donations’ in this regard gratefully accepted. But they better be big ones! If you gets my drift.</p>
<h6 class="author"><strong>Greg Maybury </strong>is a freelance writer based in Australia. His main areas of interest are US history and politics in general, with a special focus on economic, financial, national security, military, and geopolitical affairs. For 6+ years he has regularly contributed to a diverse range of alternative, independent media (AIM), news and opinion sites, including OffGuardian, Dissident Voice, OpEd News, The Greanville Post, Consortium News, Information Clearing House (ICH), Dandelion Salad, Global Research, and others.</h6>

<div class="comment even thread-even depth-1 wpd-comment wpd_comment_level-1" id="wpd-comm-440057_0"><div class="wpd-comment-wrap wpd-blog-guest">
<div class="wpd-comment-left">
<div class="wpd-avatar">
<img alt="Greg Maybury" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/dfd4e34feb287b54f19d681e093fce4a?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/dfd4e34feb287b54f19d681e093fce4a?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-440057">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Greg Maybury
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 6, 2021 6:34 AM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 6, 2021 6:34 AM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F02%2Fthe-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal%2F%23comment-440057" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-440057"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Hello OffG Readers, Many 🙏🏼 to all those who contributed to the discussion. Especially to those who took the trouble to provide links to the work of numerous people who have done some excellent work in exposing this insidious agenda for what it is. Some of these folks’ work I am familiar with, others not so much. I will endeavour as best I can to follow these links and suggestions up. </p>
<p>This for me though represents one of the most frustrating and perplexing aspects of the Covid Thing. One the one hand we have enormous amounts of information coming at us from so many terrific sources, and not enough time to absorb it all. In a way, that’s a nice problem to have I suppose. But the downside I guess is that no matter how much information and solid evidence we receive or have access to, it seems we are all on a hiding to nothing trying to convince our nearest and dearest (let alone others outside that circle) that something is terribly wrong with this Covid agenda. Such is the awesome power of the propaganda and censorship regime in place.</p>
<p>For his part the estimable Mark Crispin Miller (MCM; one of the ‘talking heads’ featured in the recent must-watch <a href="https://off-guardian.org/2021/09/13/covid-9-11-forever-war/">OffGuardian Covid/911</a> series), calls this much touted crisis “a global war against humanity…”. I agree, going as far as calling it <em>the most </em>insidious, reprehensible scam/plot/psyop ever perpetrated on an unsuspecting public by our un-elected ‘Brahmin’ billionaire castes and their useful idiots in the ranks of the political classes and in the corporate, mainstream media. A big call to be sure!</p>
<p>Speaking of the media, one of the most disappointing aspects has been <a href="https://gregmaybury.substack.com/p/the-alt-indie-media-and-the-cognitive" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank">the broad failure </a>of the <em>alternative-independent media (AIM)</em> to take up the Covid fight. On this, MCM also had plenty to say recently. We might say these folks in the AIM—all presumably righteous, self-respecting truth pilgrims with ‘street-cred’ to spare—are deemed by MCM (and your humble) as ‘guilty’ as it were of <em>praise by faint damnation</em>! To wit: If you’re not challenging the Covid narrative, you must be supporting it, even if only doing so tacitly, in which case your integrity and credibility is up for grabs.</p>
<p>On the other hand, although thankfully by no means the only voice in the AIM taking up the fight, OffGuardian remains an exemplar, and we should all be eternally grateful for people like Kit and Catte for having the moxie to ‘mix it up’ with these misanthropes! Because that’s what we’re dealing with. These inhuman miscreants treat the vast bulk of humanity as “deplorable”, surplus to requirements. “Useless eaters” is the going phrase. We don’t need the test results back from the lab to know there are rats in the gravy to appreciate this singular reality! Put slightly differently, I say to those who who refuse to see what is going down here: Your myopia is our dystopia in the making!</p>
<p>Stay strong💪remain righteous!✊👍🙏🏼 😎</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Shadowy figures you’ve never heard of…International banks…think tanks…philanthropic organisations…”royal” families…gov and all beaurocracy…all institutions including science and education etc…alphabet soup agencies…media…the stone cold moron at the supermarket who tries to force a mask on you. </p>
<p>They’re all out to get you.</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-left">
<div class="wpd-avatar">
<img alt="George Mc" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5fdd943d9ddc48d0d81f2f9071aee6d4?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5fdd943d9ddc48d0d81f2f9071aee6d4?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-438826">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
George Mc
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 3, 2021 3:25 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 3, 2021 3:25 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F02%2Fthe-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal%2F%23comment-438826" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-438826"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>It seems to me that the class war is now manifesting itself in a new way in the age of covid. And the divide can be outlined by the terms ATL and BTL (Above The Line and Below The Line). Of course there are covid sceptic sites like OffG where the ATL material, i.e. the actual articles, are worth reading and provide genuine insight. But as a matter of course the vast majority of ATL material is pure corporate sponsored propaganda funded by the usual suspects – even if they hide themselves at multiple displacements. The phony “fearless investigator” can “uncover” any number of “Right Wing” sites by simply highlighting the funding sources which actually run through <strong><em>all</em></strong> the major sites – including of course <strong><em>his own site</em></strong>. And all of these mouthpieces for the vested interests ceaselessly weave their webs of deception and play their little games of “unmasking” the designated clowns.</p>
<p>Many of these sites do not permit comments at all. Many who do may have comments that are phony. How can you tell? Of course it is impossible to be sure but I would have thought anyone with any genuine power of critique will have picked up on the basic tropes by now. The litmus test is the covid dogma whereby it is perfectly permissible to critique the lockdown, the masks, the distancing etc., just as long as you accept the fundamental prop of the virus itself.  </p>
<p>The perfect example is Toby Young’s “Lockdown Sceptics” now “The Daily Sceptic”. It seemed like a site sceptical of covid but the very original title gave the game away: in accordance with the covid move, it was the “attempts to fight the deadly virus” that were at the centre of censure. Originally the ATL material reflected this a little. But this soon gave way to covid question begging. Meanwhile the BTL comments continued with the genuine covid scepticism and soon became the only reason for visiting the site.</p>
<p>Ah but the ATL area features the designated experts guiding us through the “disinfo” to get to the truth in the same way that, in mediaeval times, the local priest had to guide illiterate peasants to the correct interpretation of Biblical passages. The Holy Word was too divine to be tainted by direct plebeian access. Later on, when these peasants became literate and morphed into the urban working classes, they were kept in check by a legal system hidden behind suitably convoluted waffle. The script of <em>Yes Minister</em> serves as a good demonstration of the technique.</p>
<p>But with the latest economic crisis and the move to pharma-capitalism, “Science” (which had gradually come to acquire a dogmatic caste in its transformation into “Scientism”) now provides the Holy Book that must be interpreted – or, to be more precise, the Holy Labyrinth of interminable scholarly articles.</p>
<p>This body of scripture (more mutable than any previous incarnation) is readily on hand to be excerpted for the aforementioned corporate sponsored sites. There is nothing like a splendid expanse of that old gish gallop to keep the masses stupefied. Meanwhile the BTL troublemakers can be ignored as cretins, riff raff and, worse of all, “conspiracy theorists”. But that is where to look to see the real deal. And that is why the litmus test works. Take Mr Richard Tax Man Murphy who actually warned his BTL contingent in advance! No Socratic dialogues for him!       </p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<p>haha…you have to chuckle…. so called right wing conspiracy theorists have been calling this nonsense out since the first ahem, racist white supremacist alabama ‘prepper’ bought his first vacuum packed moon man meals to put in his hand built concrete bunker/armoury in the early seventies… always ridiculed was old dentally challenged (retarded?) cletus in alabama…</p>
<p>he didn’t trust the government… no siree..</p>
<p>one could attribute his paranoia to psychosis or ignorance but in hindsight it looks more like foresight.. (NO… not better by a darn sight )… such imbeciles have had many names hung on them by terminally selfish and deathly comfortable ‘right on lefties’… </p>
<p>marginalized, ridiculed….. victims of the alphabet men lexicon, the x chromosome files…</p>
<p>one thing’s for sure ‘going forward’ into the rather old and tired abnormal… there will be no shortage of epithets..</p>
<p>nor imbeciles neither..</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I had to laugh when you mentioned the Lockdown Sceptics site. After several months it became clear that the editors hankered to keep a foot inside the tent and didn’t want to lose out on dinner party invites further down the line. Certain lines were not crossed, a slant that became more awkward with each week. The prole commentators were quick to spot this and have ended up providing more genuinely insightful material below the line, which is now the only reason I visit the site.</p>
</div>

<img alt="Malatok" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/2780e21c391323dfdbec236220a8dc55?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/2780e21c391323dfdbec236220a8dc55?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-438806">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Malatok
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 3, 2021 2:28 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 3, 2021 2:28 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F02%2Fthe-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal%2F%23comment-438806" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-438806"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>The vertical pigs crushing skulls for the privilege of sticking their snouts in the swill of the regime’s trough is the real swine flu epidemic that the sheeple have to deal with in the ongoing covaids intelligence test.</p>
<p><strong>As Edward Bernays said in his book “Propaganda:”</strong><br/>
<strong><em>“If we understand the mechanism and motives of the group mind, it is now possible to control and regiment the masses according to our will without them knowing it.”</em></strong><br/>
 <br/>
 </p>
<blockquote><p>Another classic example: 2009, La Gloria, Mexico. Smithfield Foods, the largest pork producer in the world, operates a giant pig farm. 950,000 pigs.</p><p><p>The urine and feces from these 950,000 pigs run out into the open air and forms what are called lagoons. They’re so large, you can see them from outer space.</p></p><p><p>Workers spray the toxic lagoons with a toxic foam. It’s routine.</p></p><p><p>Workers, and people in the surrounding neighborhood, are getting sick and dying. So new contractors are brought in to spray the lagoons with yet another toxic chemical.</p></p><p><p>Out of nowhere, guess who shows up? The CDC.</p></p><p><p>Guess what they conclude? It’s not the urine and feces lagoons or the toxic chemicals causing illness and death. No. Of course not.</p></p><p><p>It’s a new mysterious virus. H1N1.</p></p><p><p>And voila, we have a new cover story and a new epidemic, called Swine Flu.</p></p><p><p>The cover story serves a number of purposes, as time passes. But the most obvious one is: Smithfield Foods is protected. They get away with murder.</p></p><p><p>And to cap it all off, four years later, in 2013, Smithfield, still protected, sells itself to a Chinese company, Shuanghui International Holdings, for $4.72 billion.</p></p><p><p>Makes you wonder. I can imagine a few Chinese intelligence professionals sitting in a room in Beijing, in 2013, expressing astonishment. “Can you believe the CDC? They sold a cover story about a virus that was so ridiculous…but it worked. Suppose we followed suit, but on a grand scale? We claim an outbreak is occurring in one of our cities. We invite the CDC and the World Health Organization to come in and help. There is no virus, but we know they’ll ‘find a new one.’ They always do. Then, boom. We do something no one has ever done before. We lock down 50 million people overnight and provide a model to the rest of the world. Other countries line up and lock down their populations, wrecking their economies. Meanwhile, we announce China has ‘recovered,’ we cancel our lockdowns and put everybody back to work. It’s a war with no shots fired, and we win. Do you think we could pull it off? Do you think we could sell it? Maybe we should talk to Bill Gates. He’s a smart guy. He always has interesting ideas…”</p></p></blockquote>
<p><em>Reprinted with permission from </em><a href="https://blog.nomorefakenews.com/" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank"><em>Jon Rappoport’s blog</em></a><em>.</em><br/>
<a href="https://www.lewrockwell.com/author/jon-rappoport/" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank">The Best of Jon Rappoport</a><br/>
<a href="https://www.lewrockwell.com/2020/12/jon-rappoport/covert-op-the-virus-as-cover-story/" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.lewrockwell.com/2020/12/jon-rappoport/covert-op-the-virus-as-cover-story/</a></p>
</div>

Oct 3, 2021 12:32 PM

<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F02%2Fthe-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal%2F%23comment-438773" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-438773"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>So – covid, the petrol crisis and global warming. And this:</p>
<blockquote><p></p><p><p>A cold, hard winter is coming because of a gas crisis that the Government had years to avert</p></p><p><p>The Government was repeatedly warned – now the consequences are playing out</p></p></blockquote>
<p>So – another scare but with a handy scapegoat to rage at. A little glimpse told me that it follows the “Boris is a bastard!” formula. But I have lost all patience with scrutinising these articles – which are gas lighting exercises anyway.</p>
<p>The aim is to terrorise and thus provide the psychological aspect in preparation for the physical assault. </p>
<p>As here:</p>
<blockquote><p></p><p><p>Why This Energy Crisis Is Different</p></p><p><p>Climate change and the policies to curb it lie behind skyrocketing gas, coal, and electricity prices in Europe and Asia.</p></p></blockquote>
<p> <br/>
And here:</p>
<blockquote><p></p><p><p>Understanding the Debate Over Covid Booster Shots</p></p><p><p>With the delta variant threatening efforts to end the pandemic, a growing number of wealthy countries are planning or considering administering booster …</p></p></blockquote>
<p>etc. etc.</p>
<p>Silent weapons for quiet wars. Or, as it turns out, not quite so quiet wars. Not anymore.</p>
</div>

</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-438757">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
George Mc

<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 3, 2021 11:46 AM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 3, 2021 11:46 AM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F02%2Fthe-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal%2F%23comment-438757" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-438757"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Philip Roddis has published one of his increasingly infrequent posts on covid. I tried to read it but it quoted an article that veered off into totally irrelevant waffle about differences in covid infections between red states and blue states which were supposed to reflect on Trump voters. Or something. I couldn’t even be bothered trying to follow it. And Philip himself gave his usual complaint about jolly rude “fanatical” covid sceptics. </p>
<p>So I drafted ten or so responses of varying tactfulness which led to imaginary conversations none of which ended well. I even copy/pasted two of them into his comment area before scrubbing them. I had totally lost interest. I’d burned myself out trying to accommodate a line of thought which I could no longer understand – and felt little incentive to understand. I see that his comment section seems to have dried up anyway. So I reckon I’m not alone in my resignation. </p>
<p>I recall the last line in Kenneth William’s diary: </p>
<blockquote><p>Oh what’s the bloody point?</p></blockquote>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-like wpd-up" title="15">15</div><div class="wpd-vote-result-sep"></div><div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-dislike wpd-down" title="-1">-1</div>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-438757">
George Mc
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>There’s no way you can talk to believers. You need to only talk about how hard life is or how it’s wise to pay your car insurance or about professional sport or about TV shows or about discounts at the supermarket or about beer or about anything else. Just don’t point out the shadows on the wall. You’ll lose and you’ll lose badly.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-438800"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-438758">
Pig Swill
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>See my response to ImpObs below.</p>
<p>I jumped ship on Philip’s blog a few months after the covid crap began. After posting my reasoning at length and receiving no counterargument I became demoralised. The final straw came when the first vaxxes arrived and I posted a critical comment on that whilst asking what he thought about it and he said – and I still can’t believe it! – <strong><em>that he was too busy looking at other matters!</em></strong><br/>
<strong><em><span class="ql-cursor">﻿</span></em></strong><br/>
I posted a final angry no-holds-barred comment and then buggered off. A few months after that he kindly sent me an email just enquiring about me and we got to chatting and I even put in a few comments on his blog again – but nothing about covid! I’d “learned my lesson”.</p>
<p>But the effect of this was so depressing. Yes we could chat about the old stuff, the pre-covid blether about how shitty capitalism was etc. And we could sagely nod over the awfulness of it all. But I felt we weren’t supposed to mention the brontosaurus herd in the room. I felt we were like musicians playing on the deck of the Titanic as it went down!</p>
</div>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-438758">
Pig Swill
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>The thing to do is to examine what arguments you presented and how you did it. Memes especially do not translate into conversation very well.</p>
<p>Look at what did not work and where the conversation steered.</p>
<p>Look for weaknesses in your argument that the encounter picked apart, especially when confronted with circular fallacies or changing meaning of terms within a line of argument. Its best to avoid these as they are constructed to trap the argument into a no win outcome.</p>
<p>Discussion is a skill like any other. We can all improve.</p>
</div>

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-438811">
someone
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Oh I get all that. But what happens when you post a detailed and tactful account of your case … and it just sits there unanswered? And when that item and comment thread recede into the horizon, another item appears with a new comment thread, and the new comments repeat points which you had already dealt with in your previous unanswered post? I could rephrase my unanswered post. And I’m sure that, once again, I’d be ignored. Indeed, from what I recall, that has happened and more than once.</p>
<p>But I’m glad I had that encounter with Philip because it gave me an insight into the mentality of the lovingly crafted “Left”. To their now chronic conspiracy phobia have been added two unshakable pillars supporting the covid narrative: first, the notion of covid as capitalism’s well deserved comeuppance and second, the notion of all covid sceptics as Right Wing reactionaries. The End.</p>
</div>

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-438757">
George Mc
</a>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>If it’s the data I think it is, it’s originally from Charles Rixey of DRASTIC, Johnathan Couey covered it ~10 days ago on his stream (Gigaohmbiological) but the VOD is not available. </p>
<p>The Dem/Rep distinction was only used because Dem state had a higher vax rate, the data was limited to the last 4 months (Delta) and showed the higher vaxed Dem states had a rising CFR compared to lower vaxed Rep states. </p>
<p>Without reading it (I have no clue who he is) it sounds like Philip Roddis is just arm waving about data he has no real clue about</p>

<img alt="George Mc" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5fdd943d9ddc48d0d81f2f9071aee6d4?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5fdd943d9ddc48d0d81f2f9071aee6d4?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-438798">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
George Mc
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 3, 2021 1:51 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 3, 2021 1:51 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F02%2Fthe-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal%2F%23comment-438798" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-438798"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-438774">
ImpObs
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>He was referring to pieces written by David Leonhardt (New York Times) and by Jeremy Beckham on “Outside Voices”.</p>
<p>The former comes under the heading “Covid’s partisan pattern is growing more extreme” and talks about figures in “Trump states” compared to “non-Trump states”. I presume this is what is meant by the “covid partisan pattern”. But any expectation of a serious debate over the nature of covid is annulled by the first line,</p>
<p>“Since Delta began circulating widely in the US, Covid has exacted a horrific death toll on red America”</p>
<p>Roddis refers to this article’s “lamentable reasoning”. But if you think he’s perhaps twigging to covid, you will be disappointed by his enthusiastic pasting in of the “correcting” Beckham piece which tells us this:</p>
<p>“To be clear: there is no question that COVID-19 vaccines are a safe, effective, important tool in protecting people from severe disease and death.”</p>
<p>To be sure, Philip adds a footnote here. But it too is dispiriting:</p>
<p>“Jeremy Beckham’s claim that Covid vaccines are safe <strong><em>has stirred a predictable hornets’ nest below the line.</em></strong> Some say it is false, others that it is true, yet others that he need not have made such a disclaimer. FWIW – which, statistically speaking, is near zilch, I had two shots of AstraZeneca with no ill effects <strong><em>beyond continuing to piss people off on this as on other matters.”</em></strong></p>
<p>At which point, and just in case you didn’t pick up on it, here is Philip’s contribution to the “covid split”:</p>
<p>“The messianic certainty I detect on all sides of the Covid conversation is dismaying. People with no obvious qualification to do so are not only sounding off in FB echo chambers as though they were leading experts, but in some cases <strong><em>declaring holy war on those less sure of ourselves</em></strong>. I’ve encountered it on all sides, <strong><em>but above all from the ‘sceptic’ camp</em></strong>.”</p>
<p>What can you do with that? For one thing “fanatical sceptic” is an oxymoron. For another, the covid mantra has been screamed non-stop in everyone’s face every day for the last 18 months whereas the sceptic case is nowhere to be seen and any allusion to it is invariably denounced as “Right Wing” if not “Fascist”.</p>
<p>And I am sick to death of this assumption of a wide eyed innocent pleading for “objectivity” amidst “the fanatics” when it is clear that he has set his mast very much to one side and will not budge. (And it’s not surprising if he gets ragged from sceptics who are probably doing their best to try and contain their anger at him!)</p>
<p>But at least his title is amusingly apt – if not in the way he intends:</p>
<p>“More crap thinking on Covid”</p>
<p>Oh what the hell, here it is:</p>
<p><a href="http://steelcityscribblings.uk/wp/2021/10/02/more-crap-thinking-on-covid/" rel="nofollow ugc">http://steelcityscribblings.uk/wp/2021/10/02/more-crap-thinking-on-covid/</a></p>
<p>Feel free to insert a comment. But I’m done!</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>

<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-438744"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>OMG, a “twindemic”!….</p>
<p><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/1499902/coronavirus-rsv-influenza-symptoms-treatment" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/1499902/coronavirus-rsv-influenza-symptoms-treatment</a></p>
<p>A piece of fear porn too ridiculous for the Fraud (although not the Express, Independent, BBC and Economist). Or perhaps Viner has the thumbscrews out for her staff who missed this one?</p>
<p>Of course if one reads the whole article, one discovers the ‘problem’ is one caused by lockdown. The solution? Well, of course it’s not to never have another lockdown and the removal from public office of everyone who supported it on grounds of massive incompetence if not malice – it’s the flu vaccine! How convenient Pfizer said last week that the flu and covid vaccines can be safely taken together!</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-438729">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Donald Duck
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Oct 3, 2021 9:55 AM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Oct 3, 2021 9:55 AM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2021%2F10%2F02%2Fthe-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal%2F%23comment-438729" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-438729"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Ok, so the plutocratic mob are in the ascendency at the present time. But I would point out that the situation facing the Great Resetters is subject to the law of diminishing returns. More lockdowns, more unemployment, more taxes, more incessant propaganda are not exactly delivering their shangri la. </p>
<p>Ultimately the truth breaks through – is breaking through – as is generally the case with tyrannical societies – propaganda, however well crafted, doesn’t necessarily put food on the table. In my neck of the woods, the UK, furloughs are ending, taxes are rising, there ar increasing shortages, there is no health service, the single policy that a social-democratic achievement by the Labour government in 1945 is no more. </p>
<p>Given that the middle-class, guardian reading woke outer party is hopelessly imbibed with the new order, it falls to the working class who will have to – and to an extent are – the progressive force. </p>
<p>Food on the table is the first law of economics/politics, and you cannot eat ideology.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I agree… past tyranny’s were always one cheek of the financialists’ fat flabby arse, ably supported by the skeleton of anglo-zionism, militarism…</p>
<p> the other cheek the supposed enemy (countries, drugs, terrorists, ideologies etc etc ad nauseum).. all cover for resource theft from ignorant proles.. (after the 2019 financial collapse the proles are now the resource, to be transhumanised and traded on ‘new exchanges’ along with the gases they exhaleand the tek they have been injected with)..</p>
<p>but they are going to have trouble with this one, because having always relied on the dialectic to corral the hapless herds ( ridiculous precepts as they were)… this one relies primarily on dividing imbeciles by dint of medical procedures…</p>
<p>at best a poor plan (because of course you may inadvertently kill off your ‘team’ with hastily concocted witches brews)…</p>
<p> but on closer inspection, resembling more the strategies of drooling lunatics…</p>
<p>on aggregate… cleansing fire is coming..</p>
</div>

<p>you held a mirror to them amigo, fuk ’em : )</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2021/10/02/the-last-of-our-human-freedoms-covid-1984-meets-the-brave-new-normal/#comment-438913"></i></span>
